en: Yea, at this my heart trembleth, And is moved out of its place.
hmr: “Hitaka khawm hin ka lungril chu ân thin a, A umna hmuna inthawk chun ân châwm a.

en: Hear, oh, hear the noise of his voice, And the sound that goeth out of his mouth.
hmr: A râwl ri chu ngai ta u, A baua inthawka ri suok le chun,

en: He sendeth it forth under the whole heaven, And his lightning unto the ends of the earth.
hmr: Vân hnuoi po poa chun a tir suok a; A kâwlinlep chu hnuoi tâwpnahai chenin a tir suok bawk a.

en: After it a voice roareth; He thundereth with the voice of his majesty; And he restraineth not the lightnings when his voice is heard.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun râwl chu ân rih a, A ropuina râwl chun a hung sukri tah a; A râwl chu hriet a ni pha chun anni chu ân châwltir nawh a.

en: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; Great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.
hmr: Pathien chun a râwlin nasatakin a sukrih a; Thil ei hmu thei naw ropuitakhai chu a thaw a nih.

en: For he saith to the snow, Fall thou on the earth; Likewise to the shower of rain, And to the showers of his mighty rain.
hmr: Vûr kuoma chun, ‘Hnuoiah tla rawh,’ a ta; Chuong ang bawkin ruo mal kuoma le A ruo nasa sûrhai kuoma chun a ti bawk a.

en: He sealeth up the hand of every man, That all men whom he hath made may know it.
hmr: Mi tin kut chu a khârkhip a, Mi po pohai a siemhai chun an hriet theina dingin.

en: Then the beasts go into coverts, And remain in their dens.
hmr: Chun, ramsahai chu pûkahai chun an feh a, An kuoahai chun an um zing a.

en: Out of the chamber of the south cometh the storm, And cold out of the north.
hmr: Simtieng pindana inthawk chun thlipui a hung a, Hmârtienga inthawkin phalbi a hung bawk a.

en: By the breath of God ice is given; And the breadth of the waters is straitened.
hmr: Pathien thuok chun vûr inkhal chu a pêk a Tui lientakhai khawm an inkhal zo a.

en: Yea, he ladeth the thick cloud with moisture; He spreadeth abroad the cloud of his lightning:
hmr: Anih, sûm sâtak chu tuihuin a sukrik a, A kâwlinlep sûm chu a thedar tah a.

en: And it is turned round about by his guidance, That they may do whatsoever he commandeth them Upon the face of the habitable world,
hmr: Chun, a ṭhuoinain ân let vêl a, Thu a pêk taphawt an thaw theina dingin; Khawvêl hluo theia um chung po poa chun.

en: Whether it be for correction, or for his land, Or for lovingkindness, that he cause it to come.
hmr: A hnuoi ta dingin amanih, sukdikna lem dingin amanih, Annawleh, zângaina leiin amani a hungtir hlak a.

en: Hearken unto this, O Job: Stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
hmr: “Aw Job, hi hi ngai ta, To veng vengin Pathien sinthaw maktakhai chu ngaituo ta.

en: Dost thou know how God layeth his charge upon them, And causeth the lightning of his cloud to shine?
hmr: An chunga chun Pathien chun ieng angin am maw ân phurtirin, A sûm kâwlinlep chu ân vartir hlak ti i hriet am?

en: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, The wondrous works of him who is perfect in knowledge?
hmr: Sûm rikziehai chu i hriet am, Hrietna famkima sip, sinthaw maktak el chu?

en: How thy garments are warm, When the earth is still by reason of the south wind?
hmr: Sim thli leia hnuoi chu a um ṭawk ṭawk laiin, Iengtin am i silfênhai chu suklumin a um a, ti i hriet am?

en: Canst thou with him spread out the sky, Which is strong as a molten mirror?
hmr: Ama ang chun vân khi keiphar thei i ti, Dârthlalang sungta anga ngar khi?

en: Teach us what we shall say unto him; For we cannot set our speech in order by reason of darkness.
hmr: Ama kuoma chun ieng am kan hril ding mîn chûktir la, Inthimna leiin kan thuhril chu kan sukrem thei si nawh a.

en: Shall it be told him that I would speak? Or should a man wish that he were swallowed up?
hmr: Thu ka hril ding a nih ti chu ama hril a ni ding am a nih? Annawleh, mi chun lem zoa um chu a nuom am a nih?

en: And now men see not the light which is bright in the skies; But the wind passeth, and cleareth them.
hmr: Tuhin mihai chun vânhaia var chu an hmu naw a nih; Amiruokchu, thli a hrâng a, anni chu a sukthiel hlak.

en: Out of the north cometh golden splendor: God hath upon him terrible majesty.
hmr: Hmârtienga inthawkin rângkachak ropuina chu a hung a; Pathien chu ropuina ṭiumtakin ân thuom a.

en: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: He is excellent in power; And in justice and plenteous righteousness he will not afflict.
hmr: Iengkimthawthei chu ei hmu suok thei nawh, Thilthawtheina le indiknaah a ropui a, Felna a hau a, nêksâwr naw nih.

en: Men do therefore fear him: He regardeth not any that are wise of heart.
hmr: Chuleiin, mihai chun ama chu an ṭih a, Lungrila vara inngaihai khawm chu a pawisa chuong nawh,” tiin.
